newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portuguese shares recover, PT, Sonae fall.
newsitem.headline: Portuguese shares recover, PT, Sonae fall.

text.p: Most Portuguese shares recovered but 'blue chips' Portugal Telecom and Sonae Investimentos fell on profit taking, dealers said. Dealers said the market would focus on construction firms Somague and A.Silva e Silva tomorrow if the CMVM allows a resumption of trade in the two stocks. The two firms said they had held conversations about a possible exchange of shares.

* Shares of Banco Comercial Portugues (BCP) did not react to the large increase in its 1996 profits which were in line with expectations, dealers said. BCP closed at 2,245 escudos, up two, in volume of 333,826 shares.
* Other active stocks which closed higher included cement group Cimpor and Banco Totta e Acores.
* Portuguese Under-Secretary for Finance Fernando Teixeira dos Santos reiterated Portugal's commitment to join Economic and Monetary Union from the start.
